meanings.sent1: After the mistake was fixed, they had to resubject the form for approval.
meanings.sent2: She had to resubject her thesis to meet the new guidelines.
meanings.sent3: The teacher jokingly threatened to resubject the class to another pop quiz.
meanings.sent4: The storm resubjected the town to power outages, causing frustration.
meanings.sent5: The detective decided to resubject the suspect to further questioning.
